intro: Malache glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular malache, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in summer. Malache glandulosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable climates.
